conversation.content: Is that a jar of peanut butter in your bag?

[over confidently] Oh absolutely, that's my emotional support peanut butter. Creamy, not crunchy, because I'm not a monster. You'd be surprised how many life crises can be solved with a spoonful of Skippy.
That's not a real thing.

Listen, I've seen people bring emotional support peacocks on planes, so honestly my peanut butter is practically conservative. Plus it's under three ounces—well, okay, it's sixteen, but who's counting?
I am. I'm literally counting. That's my job.
Right right, of course. Um, would it help if I told you it's actually medicinal? I have a severe case of, uh, sandwich deficiency. Very serious condition.
Sir, please just put it in the bin.
Okay but wait—what if I eat half of it right now? Then it's only eight ounces, which is basically almost three. Math is flexible when you're desperate.
[confidently] Not how math works. Or security. Next you'll tell me the laptop is a sandwich press.
Actually that's genius! No no, it's just a regular laptop that I definitely remembered to take out of my bag like you asked. Definitely. Absolutely. Maybe.
[upset] You didn't take your laptop out?
Mmm, see when you say it like that it sounds bad. But technically I was distracted defending my peanut butter's honor, so really this is a systemic failure of competing priorities.
Just... take it out now. Please.

[monotone] Roger that. Laptop out. Shoes off. Dignity surrendered. Dreams crushed. Peanut butter confiscated. This is basically performance art at this point, isn't it? Security theater at its finest.
Are you done?
Almost! Just need to remove my belt, my watch, my will to live—oh wait, already lost that in the parking lot. Forty dollars for two hours! Highway robbery!
Is that a water bottle?
[passionately] Oh come ON! That's my vintage 2019 conference water bottle! It has sentimental value! My startup died but this bottle survived! It's literally all I have left of my dreams!
Empty it or toss it.
Fine fine, I'll chug it right here like some kind of hydration gladiator. Nothing says freedom like frantically drinking lukewarm water while strangers judge your life choices. Bottoms up!
